page.title: 18FUTURE HOPES FOR BURGHILL
page.content: We discussed our hopes for the future. Most people thought that nucleur weapons should be destroyed and that there should be better relationships between Western and communist countries. We hope that this area remains much the same as it is now because it is a lovely place to live. Wildlife should be protected and more should be done to protect hedgerows. These important wildlife habitats are rapidly vanishing as farming changes .We would like to see the end of all blood sports.We hope that the village schools remain open as it is important that younger children are educated in their own villages. Older houses and interesting buildings in our area should be kept as they are.
